title: [py3.7] Deprecation on using collections.abc.X as collections.X
body_html:
Python 3.7.0 (default, Jun 28 2018, 13:15:42)
[GCC 7.2.0] :: Anaconda, Inc. on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import collections
>>> collections.Mapping
__main__:1: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3
.8 it will stop working
<class 'collections.abc.Mapping'>

We have a couple places where we use Sequence, Mapping, Iterable, Iterator, etc., e.g.,

pytorch/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py

Line 190 in ce8e8fe

elif isinstance(batch[0], collections.Mapping):
body_text:

[GCC 7.2.0] :: Anaconda, Inc. on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import collections
>>> collections.Mapping
__main__:1: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3
.8 it will stop working
<class 'collections.abc.Mapping'>
We have a couple places where we use Sequence, Mapping, Iterable, Iterator, etc., e.g., 
  
    
      pytorch/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py

           elif isinstance(batch[0], collections.Mapping):
body:
```py
Python 3.7.0 (default, Jun 28 2018, 13:15:42)
[GCC 7.2.0] :: Anaconda, Inc. on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import collections
>>> collections.Mapping
__main__:1: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3
.8 it will stop working
<class 'collections.abc.Mapping'>
```

We have a couple places where we use `Sequence`, `Mapping`, `Iterable`, `Iterator`, etc., e.g., https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/ce8e8feceba5aaa9e66f487bc03cc2d84ef857b9/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py#L190
